title: Inanna Publications
text:
Inanna Publications and Education Inc. is a Canadian <a href="book%20publisher">book publisher</a> based in <a href="Toronto">Toronto</a>, <a href="Ontario">Ontario</a>. Inanna publishes <a href="%C3%89criture%20f%C3%A9minine">women's writing</a>, including a <a href="Literary%20magazine">journal</a>, <a href="literary%20fiction">literary fiction</a>, <a href="poetry">poetry</a>, and academic books. Inanna's books are on a wide variety of feminist topics accessible to the largest possible community of women. Inanna "is bucking the trend – and flourishing." Most of Inanna Publications' books are collected at <a href="Harvard%20Library">Harvard Library</a>. Inanna's writers have won several <a href="Independent%20Publisher%20Book%20Awards">Independent Publisher Book Awards</a> and <a href="Canadian%20Jewish%20Book%20Awards">Canadian Jewish Book Awards</a>, and have been shortlisted for <a href="the%20League%20of%20Canadian%20Poets">the League of Canadian Poets</a>'s <a href="Raymond%20Souster%20Award">Raymond Souster Award</a>, the <a href="Western%20Mail%20%28Wales%29">Western Mail (Wales)</a> Book of the Year, the <a href="Lambda%20Literary%20Foundation">Lambda Literary Foundation</a> awards, and have been among the <a href="Toronto%20Book%20Award">Toronto Book Award</a> finalists.
History.
Founded in 1978, Inanna Publications—whose name is related to <a href="Inanna">Inanna</a>, Goddess of Love, Wisdom, War, Fertility and Lust—started to publish an <a href="academic%20journal">academic journal</a> and books. In 2004, it launched the Inanna Poetry and Fiction Series.
Academic Journal.
Inanna is the publisher for "<a href="Canadian%20Woman%20Studies">Canadian Woman Studies</a>"/"Les Cahiers de la Femme", which is one of Canada’s oldest feminist journals.
